message: looks fine to me Alex
it seems you are behind a proxy ( squid)
what do u get if you use : http://www.hidemyass.com/

Just for my sanity, is everyone seeing apps.kynetx.com just fine? I get this: The requested URL could not be retrieved

While trying to retrieve the URL: http://apps.kynetx.com/

The following error was encountered:

Unable to determine IP address from host name for apps.kynetx.com
The dnsserver returned:

Server Failure: The name server was unable to process this query.
This means that:

 The cache was not able to resolve the hostname presented in the URL. 
 Check if the address is correct. 
Your cache administrator is root. 
Generated Tue, 26 Apr 2011 03:36:49 GMT by Firewall (squid/2.5.STABLE3)
any networking ninjas have any ideas?
everything ok here from Peru
awesome. At least everyone else can see it. Hmm..
yup. Just ssh tunneled to an external server to serve my requests for me
haha. Well now I am good because I ssh tunneled. So I have confirmed it is my ISP's ill configured firewall
but its probably my dns.
But what im confused about is that its resolving all other domains just fine
Same problem here. I'll keep an eye on it.
what's your ISP so we can avoid it?
I use Open DNS. My ISP was modifiying DNS requests. I should use a different ISP.
and it resolves just fine
lame
Qwest.
My DNS is back.
You should use a different DNS provider.
For testing, I checked the OpenDNS cache checker, then set my servers right to OpenDNS and ran some nslookup queries.
Can't believe Qwst would diddle your DNS packets that's crazy.

> www.kynetx.com
;; Got SERVFAIL reply from 208.67.222.222, trying next server
;; Got SERVFAIL reply from 208.67.222.222, trying next server
Server:		208.67.220.220
Address:	208.67.220.220#53

** server can't find www.kynetx.com: SERVFAIL
I use OpenDNS. And Digis. And ssh tunnel to xmisson as needed.
I think it was a mistake, as it vanished pretty quick.
